title: Understand Spontaneity of Reaction
text: The spontaneity of a reaction is determined by the Gibbs Free Energy change. For a process to be spontaneous, the change in Gibbs Free Energy (ΔG) should be negative.

title: Gibbs Free Energy Formula
text: Recall the formula for Gibbs Free Energy: $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$, where ΔH is enthalpy change, T is temperature in Kelvin, and ΔS is entropy change.

title: Determine Enthalpy and Entropy
text: Given the enthalpy of fusion (ΔH_{fusion}) is $$5.65$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and the entropy of fusion (ΔS_{fusion}) is $$28.9$$ J/K*mol., convert ΔH_{fusion} to $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ for consistency.

title: Calculate ΔG for Ammonia at 170K
text: Using the formula $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$, calculate ΔG at $$170$$ K. Use ΔH_{fusion} $$=$$ $$5650$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ and ΔS_{fusion} $$=$$ $$28.9$$ $$\frac{J}{K} mol$$.

title: Solve for ΔG
text: Calculate the value of ΔG from the previous step: $$ΔG=5650-170\times28.9$$.

title: Interpret ΔG
text: If ΔG is negative, the process is spontaneous. If positive or zero, it is non-spontaneous or at equilibrium.
